question: What is the purpose of the Latent Mirror node in ComfyUI?
answer: The Latent Mirror node in ComfyUI is used to mirror a latent along the Y (vertical/left to right) or X (horizontal/top to bottom) axis, and is best used as part of an img2img workflow.

question: Where can I find an example nodes JSON for the Latent Mirror node in ComfyUI?
answer: An example nodes JSON for the Latent Mirror node in ComfyUI can be found at https://github.com/spro/comfyui-mirror/blob/main/examples/latent-mirror-example.json, which uses Efficiency Nodes (https://github.com/LucianoCirino/efficiency-nodes-comfyui).

question: How do I install the Latent Mirror node in ComfyUI?
answer: To install the Latent Mirror node in ComfyUI, clone the repo into `ComfyUI/custom_nodes` by running the following commands in your terminal: `cd ComfyUI/custom_nodes`, `git clone https://github.com/spro/comfyui-latentmirror`, and then restart and refresh ComfyUI.

question: What are the two types of mirroring supported by the Latent Mirror node in ComfyUI?
answer: The Latent Mirror node in ComfyUI supports mirroring along the Y (vertical/left to right) axis and the X (horizontal/top to bottom) axis.

question: Is the Latent Mirror node in ComfyUI best used for img2img workflows or for other types of workflows?
answer: The Latent Mirror node in ComfyUI is best used as part of an img2img workflow.

question: What should I do after cloning the Latent Mirror node repo into `ComfyUI/custom_nodes`?
answer: After cloning the Latent Mirror node repo into `ComfyUI/custom_nodes`, you should restart and refresh ComfyUI to complete the installation.

question: Can I see example images demonstrating the results of using the Latent Mirror node in ComfyUI?
answer: Yes, you can see example images demonstrating the results of using the Latent Mirror node in ComfyUI at https://github.com/spro/comfyui-latentmirror/blob/main/examples/nodes.png and https://github.com/spro/comfyui-latentmirror/blob/main/examples/example.png.
